description.displayText: Jayna stepped in during the Pandemic to not only care for my 3 year old  but guide him through curriculum, flash cards, cooking, hikes, reading. She always had an art project and a plan and my toddler thrived because of it. She will be missed. Wise beyond her years with a hometown heart. I could go on and on.
description.originalText: Jayna stepped in during the Pandemic to not only care for my 3 year old  but guide him through curriculum, flash cards, cooking, hikes, reading. She always had an art project and a plan and my toddler thrived because of it. She will be missed. Wise beyond her years with a hometown heart. I could go on and on.

description.displayText: Jayna is a treasure! My wife and I have used her for about a year and a half for date nights and when the kids have days off of school. My five year old daughter just adores Jayna and is always begging to see her, while my seven year old son loves how energetic and upbeat she is. The kiddos are never bored with her and I always know they are safe. My wife and I go over to my mother in-law's for the day a few times a week since the pandemic started to help her out. Once it was safe to have a sitter again Jayna Started to take care of the kids on those days. Her creativity in coming up with new, fun, exciting, and most importantly safe activities for the kids in the midst of covid has amazed my wife and I. Themed picnic's (out of the city), impressive crafts, enriching imagination games, and so much more. Jayna has always made sure my kiddos are eating healthily (with a little room for ice cream), staying safe, and involved. Her mask safety and general sanitation has put my mind at ease.

description.displayText: I usually wouldn't write a review, but Jayna is a treasure! She has been our favorite sitter for date nights for a year and a half now, occasionally she has taken care of the kids if they have a day off of school as well. My five year old daughter just adores Jayna and my seven year old son loves how energetic and upbeat she is. Jayna has always kept my kids safe, and I have never questioned her judgment. My mother in-law lives alone and since the pandemic started my wife and I go over to her house to help her tidy up and cook a few times a week. At first the kids would come with, but for covid safety reasons we decided that they not come. Jayna has been so helpful in these scary times, when my wife and I get home the kids have always done so many fun activities, Jayna has been so creative in coming up with fun and exciting activities that are pandemic safe for both my kiddos. Not only has she continued to enrich their lives she has also been very aware of mask safety and hand washing.

description.displayText: If I could give Jayna 100 stars, I would. Jayna watched our 4-year-old during the summer when I worked as an essential worker needed on site without daycare. Later, we became a family-share with a 3-year-old in the neighborhood. Jayna navigated every and all complexity of our challenging schedules, managed transportation, and even took the kids on exciting outdoor activities and field trips. She also ensured masks and hand sanitizer were used in any place outside of the home. She brought activities with her, engaged in art and learning activities, baked with them, and she was very effective in managing conflict. I'm a hospital psychologist, so I have a good sense of this. Jayna is extremely mature for her age. Her sense of responsibility is great and she was completely reliable. I would recommend her in a heartbeat.
